greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2*n+1 as p + 3^k + 5^m, where p is a prime, and k and m are nonnegative integers.
comment: Note that a(21323543) = 0, i.e., the odd number 2*21323543 + 1 = 42647087 cannot be written as the sum of a prime, a power of 3 and a power of 5.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Mixed sums of primes and other terms, in: Additive Number Theory (edited by D. Chudnovsky and G. Chudnovsky), pp. 341-353, Springer, New York, 2010.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Apr 28 2018
